text.en: Today might just be a 'day'. That blasted cook shut the hall without even feeding us all.
He's downright lazy, that one.
I'll try to sway him.
I'm gonna try to get Gideon to put that lazy one in his place.
Did you speak to the chef yet?
Yes.
Not yet - Leave -
Guess the answer ?
A 'No' and a disrespect look in his eyes ?
And... he called me filthy kid.
Don't worry,  I did not have high hopes on that annoying chef.
Are you lost?
Yes... I still do not understand my role here.
No... just passing by. - Leave -
Then ask me wathever you want, that's what friends are for.
Well that old man's story is very long you know?

He is a noble from the house of Hawthorne, renowned for its knowledge on archery. He became the best markshman in Zalium, and ended up being one of the four people considered "Elite soldiers" in the whole empire, which formed the Royal Guard.
Which are your doubts ?
Sir Gideon was someone important in the past, right?
What does Sir Gideon gain from teaching us ?
I'm fine, thanks. - Leave -

Remember the soldier group called the Royal Guard ? Despite being the best on our empire, they faced a battle not even them could win, Sir Gideon was the only survivor. That traumatizing experience still follows him today.
All he strives for now, is leaving the battlefield, to do so he must train a new generation of soldiers able to replace those "Elite soldiers" so that the cycle keeps going.
And those replaces are you and me, maybe someone else from the Rogue Squad, but they will have to improve to do so.
I mean, you've two years more in the Rogue Squadron than I. I fight worse by far, and truth be told, you're just better suited to it than I am.
They think a woman can't hold power proper, and they're scared witless we might be better at it than them.
Thank you! If there be any chance, I'd like a steak with mashed potatoes.
That bald man won't lift a finger to fetch us food, mark my words.
What brings you here this early?
Practicin'  my stance. C' mon, fight me.
No thanks, I'd prefer a morning walk first.
Alright, let's get on with it! Think before you act, pick who's makin' the move, what they'll do, and who it'll affect. Do all that before you let me strike! Smart moves win fights.
Hey, Cassian! I was messin' about with a new move, care to test it the hard way?
Hold fast, I'm dyin' of thirst here. Gotta get water.
Sure do. Can't get rusty now, can I?
Right then, I'm off. Catch you later.
You ready or what?
I am, nothing beats a calm mind.
Not yet, still need to fully wake up.
Fine! Let me know when you're set.
I'd prefer a morning walk first, thanks.
Not bad today. Have a good day.
Actually, I did get a bread with the properties of a rock. Want a bite?
Yes of course, thanks!
We should go to our daily training with Sir Gideon, we are already late again...
I'm back.
You liar! Gideon will hit you to the ground if you don't go.
Just came back from training with the bald man.
How was it?
He was far more intense than usual.
Must be the audience.
Audience...?
Why it has to be me?
Yeah, might be.
You will represent the entire Rogue squadron and show your skills in combat to the emperor to show him our progress. Remember?
He really wants it to go as perfect as it can be.
Nice sword, it will look good on you during the audience.
And now... what are we to do?
